doc.repnme: Launching sector reforms : supporting the Government of India pilot demand-responsive approaches to rural water supply and sanitation
doc.abstracts: The Government of India has embarked on a program of Rural Water Supply and Sanitation 'sector reforms', to shift to more demand-responsive and participatory approaches by empowering local governments and community groups to fully manage their own services. The program is to be implemented in a phased manner and implementation will take place in batches. The primary actors will include the district institution, local users committees, and nongovernmental organizations. If successful, the sector reform pilots could lead the way for all rural areas in India in demand-responsive delivery of water supply and sanitation. The potential for strengthening local government and thereby opening the door for more effective delivery of other services is also vast. Although fully funded by the government, a role does exist for donors to support the process and assist in capacity-building.
